ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate
Class PairAggregator<T>

java.lang.Object
  ch.lambdaj.function.aggregate.PairAggregator<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Aggregator<T>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Chooser, InitializedPairAggregator
public abstract class PairAggregator<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Aggregator<T>

An aggregator that uses the definition of how to aggregate a pair of items and of the empty (idempotent respect to this aggregation) item.

Author:
Mario Fusco

Constructor Detail

PairAggregator

public PairAggregator()
Method Detail

aggregate

public T aggregate(java.util.Iterator<? extends T> iterator)
Aggregates the objects in the given iterable by aggregating the i-th item with the aggreagation of all the former i-1 items. The first item is aggregated with what as been defined as the empty (idempotent) item.

Specified by:
aggregate in interface Aggregator<T>
Parameters:
iterator - The objects to be aggregated
Returns:
The aggregation of the objects

emptyItem

protected abstract T emptyItem()
Returns the idempotent item for this aggregation operation

aggregate

protected abstract T aggregate(T first,
                               T second)
Defines how this operation aggregates 2 different objects

Parameters:
first - The first object to be aggregated
second - The second object to be aggregated
Returns:
The aggregation of first and second objects
